info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 4:23AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Brief near blizzard conditions possible. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches today. West-southwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Cold with lake effect tonight. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana and southwest Michigan. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and drifting snow will impact north to south roads. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches that could cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst travel conditions from snow and blowing snow will be this morning into the early afternoon. After a lull late this afternoon, additional lake effect accumulations are expected tonight into Sunday afternoon. Wind chills will drop to 10 to 20 below zero tonight into Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
